title: Fitness Classes
paragraph: These can range from yoga and Pilates to high-intensity interval training (HIIT), spinning, Zumba, and more.

title: Personal Training
paragraph: One-on-one sessions with a certified trainer who can create personalized workout plans and provide guidance and motivation.

title: Strength Training
paragraph: Free weights, weight machines, and functional training equipment for building strength and muscle.

title: Nutritional Guidance
paragraph: Some gyms offer nutrition counseling or workshops to help members achieve their fitness goals through diet.

title: Cardio Machines
paragraph: Treadmills, ellipticals, stationary bikes, rowing machines, etc., for cardiovascular workouts.

title: Group Exercise
paragraph: Group workouts led by instructors, which could include anything from circuit training to boot camps.

title: Recovery Services
paragraph: Some gyms provide amenities like saunas, steam rooms, or recovery equipment like foam rollers and massage tools.

title: Specialized Programs
paragraph: Such as programs for seniors, children, individuals with specific health conditions, or athletes looking for sports-specific training.

title: Additional Amenities
paragraph: Showers, lockers, towel service, and sometimes even on-site shops for fitness gear or supplements.
